name: TheAtlantic
text: “Alaric stands with Attila among Rome’s best-known antagonists,” Cullen Murphy writes, “but the source material is gossamer-thin.” https://t.co/zYUZMivUnk

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to @alexismadrigal update @jameshamblin and @katlwells on the coronavirus numbers — and why the spread of the pandemic seems so random: https://t.co/5rFuacTYFy

name: TheAtlantic
text: From open-air cafés to drive-in theaters at airports, how might the pandemic transform cities? @YasmeenSerhan considers the possibilities: https://t.co/V7L2TVBYjs

name: TheAtlantic
text: Films like "Do the Right Thing" and "The Spook Who Sat by the Door" frame urban uprisings as just actions against brutality and as catalysts for change. @samshepPhD on movies about American protest: https://t.co/sCBRoBFSuR

name: TheAtlantic
text: Banks have been behaving badly again, and another financial crisis, hastened by the pandemic, could be on the horizon, writes @FrankPartnoy. This one could be worse than the last: https://t.co/kalM7O3sWr

name: TheAtlantic
text: "By spurning congressional Democrats’ efforts to dispatch additional aid to state and local governments, McConnell is enabling budgetary crises in city after city," @PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/2kwQKdyUsy

name: TheAtlantic
text: Under the constant surveillance, suspicion, and violence of law enforcement in America, black people share a kinship of calamity, @jemartisby writes: https://t.co/3fqCKHR9Rq

name: TheAtlantic
text: Silence is safer than whispering. Whispering is safer than talking. Talking is safer than singing. But if you must sing, there might be ways to make it safer, @jameshamblin writes in this week's Paging Dr. Hamblin: https://t.co/OQLa8Vwlmf

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @prashantrao: For the first time since the 1950s, the US has an open consulate in Greenland.

Former Danish PM @AndersFoghR wrote in @TheAtlantic about how Greenland should be a source of unity for the US and Denmark, yet it has become a source of contention: https://t.co/K8QAJOhWyv https://t.co/tu4USydJXU

name: TheAtlantic
text: Tomorrow, 2 p.m. ET: Staff writers @AnnieLowrey and @AdamHSays discuss efforts for police reform. “What are the police for? Why are we paying for this?” Lowrey asked in her latest article about the movement to defund the police. Read here: https://t.co/7V1Lt21YXa

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump wanted to bring down the hammer, but he couldn’t get his people to actually do it. To put it in terms the president would understand: Weak!" @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write. https://t.co/KLt7luj2nh

name: TheAtlantic
text: Banks have been behaving badly again, and another financial crisis, hastened by the pandemic, could be on the horizon, writes @FrankPartnoy. This one could be worse than the last: https://t.co/5wfc402XIi

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The irony of training at bases named for those who took up arms against the United States, and for the right to enslave others, is inescapable to anyone paying attention. Now, belatedly, is the moment for us to pay such attention," David Petraeus writes: https://t.co/Su43ShNtin

name: TheAtlantic
text: “You about to lose yo job,” a months-old warning from a black woman who was being detained, has become the protest song of the moment. @skornhaber on how demonstrators are creating new political anthems: https://t.co/MHNc0JVeB1

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Living a black life in Minneapolis means sitting in disparity between your good-natured neighbors and a system of structural racism and disenfranchisement enforced through policy, white silence, and police violence," @JustinNXT writes: https://t.co/v6AWU9JjqA

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Alaric stands with Attila among Rome’s best-known antagonists,” Cullen Murphy writes, “but the source material is gossamer-thin.” https://t.co/Jn3eOwFyGL

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Trump wanted to bring down the hammer, but he couldn’t get his people to actually do it. To put it in terms the president would understand: Weak!" @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write. https://t.co/nGoGCRtxZM
